Diverse speakers in STEM Database of databases of diverse speakers in STEM (includes some of the tools in this table, and much more) Diverse speakers in STEM lists
CiteBetter A community-driven pledge to promote equitable and inclusive citation practices, especially for scholars of color and non-cis-male voices. Offers minimum standards across roles (students, teachers, researchers, department chairs) to actively address citation bias. â€œOur Pledgeâ€ and â€œStatement of Purposeâ€ of citebetter.com
Citation justice in STEMM McGill library list of tools and resources to help diversity reading and perform citation audits How to diversify your citations - Citation Justice in STEMM - Guides at McGill Library
Citation Practice Self-Audits Faculty-led assessments of syllabi and reading lists to identify underrepresentation of women and scholars of color; encourages more inclusive citation practices across teaching and publishing. Promotes critical reflection and gradual change. Promising Practices for Addressing the Underrepresentation of Women in Science, Engineering, and Medicine.
Equity-Informed Editorial and Review Guidelines Proposes journals adopt guidelines that encourage authors, editors, and reviewers to consider gender and racial balance in citations. Promotes institutional accountability in publishing. Promising Practices for Addressing the Underrepresentation of Women in Science, Engineering, and Medicine.
Diverse Sources Database of experts to include more underrepresented voices and perspectives in science, health and environment work Diverse Sources
Women in Neuroscience Women in neuroscience Women in Neuroscience Repo - Repository (winrepo.org)
500 Women Scientists Women scientists across disciplines https://500womenscientists.org/
Anne's List Women systems neuroscientists AnnesList
Women in Coastal Geoscience and Engineering Aims to inspire, support, and encourage women at all career stages through networking and mentoring WICGE
Women in Earth and Environmental Sciences in Australasia Creating a unified Australasian network of women working in Earth and Environmental Sciences in academia, industry and government WOMEESA
Global South Climate Database The Global South Climate Database is a publicly available, searchable database of scientists and experts in the fields of climate science, policy and energy. Global South Climate Database - Carbon Brief
BIPOC-authored psychology papers A moderated database of papers to help course instructors diversify their syllabi. BIPOC-authored Psychology Papers - Google Sheets
Black in Neuro Black neuroscientists Black In Neuro
Cite Black authors Black authors across disciplines Cite Black Authors â€“ A database for academic research by Black authors
BlackComputerHer Black women and girls in computing and tech citeHER Bibliography (blackcomputeher.org)
Cite Black Women Collective A movement that engages with social media and aesthetic representation (t-shirts) in order to push people to critically rethink the politics of knowledge production by engaging in a radical praxis of citation that acknowledges and honors Black womenâ€™s transnational intellectual production. Cite Black Women. - HOME (citeblackwomencollective.org)
Canadian Black Scientists Network The Canadian Black Scientists Network (CBSN) exists to Elevate, make Visible, Celebrate and Connect Black Canadians in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics & Medicine (STEMM) across sectors. Canadian Black Scientists
BiasWatchNeuro A website that tracks the women:men ratio of invited speakers at neuroscience conferences, workshops, and courses, as well as authors in neuroscience journals and recipients of neuroscience awards. biaswatchneuro
500 Queer Scientists Queer scientists https://500queerscientists.com/
The Bee Literary magazine, online platform, podcast, and the heart of a writing community. Our mission is to nurture, publish and promote the best new working-class writing by new and established working-class writers and visual artists. The Bee - A home for working-class readers and writers
Home - New Writing North
marginalia Marginalia are committed to [â€¦] promoting female, non-gender conforming, POC, LGBTQIA+, differently abled or in any other way not promoted by the status quo in academia. https://www.marginaliascience.com/
Reviewer Zero Reviewer Zero aims to transform peer review in psychology and related fields to be more formative and constructive, reducing bias and promoting equity, especially for underserved groups. They provide training for reviewers, develop supportive review practices, and promote diverse research perspectives. Reviewer Zero - https://www.reviewerzero.net
JANE (Journal/Author Name Estimator) Find papers, journals or authors based on your manuscript title, abstract or keywords. Can be used to find peer reviewers or additional literature to cite. JANE: journal/author name estimator - https://jane.biosemantics.org/
Diversity Reading List in Philosophy Diversity in philosophy Diversity Reading List â€“ Helping you include authors from under-represented groups in your teaching
Advancing big-team reproducible science through increased representation (ABRIR) ABRIR is a working group that aims to diagnose the unique barriers to leadership & participation in Big-team/Open Science faced by researchers from LMICs (low-to-middle income countries). https://abrirpsy.org/about/abrir-hubs/
Framework for Open and Reproducible Research Training (FORRT) - Neurodiversity Supporting the messages of both open scholarship and neurodiversity will ensure that the goals of diversity, equity, and inclusion reach across populations and explicitly include neurodivergent people. https://forrt.org/neurodiversity/

To submit to the database: Qualtrics Survey | Qualtrics Experience Management
Indigenous Science Network A network promoting First Nation/Indigenous science. Regular newsletters and resources for educators. https://research.acer.edu.au/isn/about.html
City University of Seattle guide to Finding Indigenous Voices Tips for how to search for Indigenous voices in research Finding Indigenous Voices - Indigenous Research and Ethics - City University of Seattle Library at City University of Seattle
Advancing Indigenous People in STEM (AISES) AISES is a national nonprofit organization focused on substantially increasing the representation of Indigenous peoples of North America and the Pacific Islands in science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM) studies and careers. AISES | Advancing Indigenous People in STEM
Anti-colonial research library (ACRL) This Library holds a collection of open-access articles and books, websites, and YouTube videos on Indigenous and anti-colonial research methodologies. Anti-Colonial Research Library
